ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INSELECTNAME=SAS-catalog-name ] 
      
Provides a selection list as input to the HPFSELECT procedure. The input
selection list is specified as a three-level name.

[Syntax: LABEL=SAS-label ] 
      
Specifies a descriptive label for the model selection to be stored in the SAS
catalog or directory.

[Syntax: NAME=SAS-name ] 
      
Names the model selection file to be stored in the SAS catalog or directory.

[Syntax: REPOSITORY=SAS-catalog-name | SAS-file-reference ] 
      
Names the SAS catalog or directory to contain the model specification.

[Syntax: VALIDATE ] 
      
Checks that model specifications exist in the model repository specified in the
REPOSITORY= option.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: DELETE specification-list ; 
      
The DELETE statement is used to remove model specifications from a selection
list. There can be any number of model specifications listed in a DELETE
statement and any number of DELETE statements.

Syntax: DIAGNOSE options ;
      
The DIAGNOSE statement is used to specify diagnostic options. DIAGNOSE options
are used by the HPFENGINE procedure to subset a model selection list according
to certain properties of a time series.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: IDMBASE=AUTO | number ] 
      
Specifies the base value of the time series used to determine the demand series
components for an intermittent demand model.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The base value is automatically determined by the time series median, minimum, and  maximum values and the INTERMITTENT= option value.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: INTERMITTENT=number ] 
      
Specifies a number greater than one that is used to determine whether or not a
time series is intermittent.

[Syntax: SEASONTEST=option ] 
      
Specifies the options related to the seasonality test.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: FORECASTOPTIONS options ; 
      
The FORECASTOPTIONS statement is used to specify forecasting options.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ALPHA=number ] 
      
Specifies the significance level to use in computing the confidence limits of
the forecast. The value of ALPHA= must be between 0 and 1. The default is
ALPHA=0.05, which produces 95% confidence intervals.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: The base value is automatically determined by the time series median, minimum,  and maximum values and the INTERMITTENT= option value.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: SELECT options ;
      
The SELECT statement is used to specify model selection options.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: CHOOSE=specification ] 
      
Specifies the name of a model specification that will be chosen by the
HPFENGINE procedure. By default, HPFENGINE will select the model with the best
fit in terms of the statistic set by the CRITERION= option.

[Syntax: CRITERION=option ] 
      
Specifies the model selection criterion (statistic of fit) to be used to select
from several candidate models. This option is often used in conjunction with
the HOLDOUT= option. The default is CRITERION=RMSE.

StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip15: Symmetric mean absolute predictive percent error
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip17: Geometric mean absolute predictive percent error
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip23: Geometric mean absolute symmetric percent error
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip43: Mean absolute error percent of standard deviation
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip44: Median absolute error percent of standard deviation
StatementOptionToolTips.@ToolTip45: Geometric mean absolute error percent of standard deviation

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: HOLDOUT=n ] 
      
Specifies the size of the holdout sample to be used for model selection. The
holdout sample is a subset of actual time series that ends at the last
nonmissing observation. The default is zero (no holdout sample).

[Syntax: HOLDOUTPCT=number ] 
      
Specifies the size of the holdout sample as a percentage of the length of the
time series.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: SPECIFICATION specification-list < / options> ;
      
The SPECIFICATION statement is used to list model specifications. There can be
any number of models specifications in the list and any number of SPECIFICATION
statements.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: EVENTMAP ( symbol= _NONE_ EVENT= eventDef <NODIFF> )
        EVENTMAP ( symbol= string EVENT= eventDef )
      
Associates events with a model specification.

[Syntax: EXMMAP ] 
      
Associates an external model specification with variable names in a DATA= data
set, thus identifying the source of forecasts and optionally prediction
standard errors, and the lower and upper confidence limits.

[Syntax: PREDICT=var ] 
      
Identifies the variable to supply forecasts and is required.

[Syntax: STDERR=var ] 
      
Identifies the variable to supply the prediction standard error.

[Syntax: LOWER=var ] 
      
Identifies the variable to supply the lower confidence limit.

[Syntax: UPPER=var ] 
      
Identifies the variable to supply the upper confidence limit.

[Syntax: EXMFUNC(string) ] 
      
Associates an external model specification with a user-defined subroutine.

[Syntax: LABEL=SAS-label ] 
      
Overrides the label in the model specification and causes the new label to
print in the model selection list in the HPFENGINE procedure. This option is
useful if you have the same model specification listed more than once and want
to distinguish between them in the HPFENGINE procedure output.

[Syntax: INPUTMAP (SYMBOL= string VAR= variable) ] 
      
Associates the symbols in a model specification with variable names in a DATA=
data set.
